article_title: Issues dividing Democrats in the Senate primary race
article_text:
Snow wants to see the country move to a single-payer system, essentially by expanding Medicare, the health system now available to the nation's senior citizens. She calls health care a human right.

Snow has set forth a plan to increase the minimum wage each January until it reaches $15.25 in 2021 and, after that, adjust it based on purchasing power. She said $12 per hour isn't enough for families to live on.

Snow said abortion should remain legal and that she would oppose efforts to restrict it.

article_metadata.description: In Utah’s Democratic Senate primary, Jonathan Swinton and Misty K. Snow agree that the nation needs to offer a path to citizenship for undocumented immigrants, limit money in politics and respond aggressively to climate change. ...
article_metadata.author: The Salt Lake Tribune

article_summary:
Snow wants to see the country move to a single-payer system, essentially by expanding Medicare, the health system now available to the nation's senior citizens.
Snow said abortion should remain legal and that she would oppose efforts to restrict it.
Snow has set forth a plan to increase the minimum wage each January until it reaches $15.25 in 2021 and, after that, adjust it based on purchasing power.
She said $12 per hour isn't enough for families to live on.
She calls health care a human right.
